metadata.title: USN-5519-1 -- Python vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that Python incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5519-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  python2.7-dev - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 python2.7-doc - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 python2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 libpython2.7-dev - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-13ubuntu1.1 No subscription required  python3.10-examples - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10 - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 libpython3.10 - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 libpython3.10-dev - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10-doc - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10-venv - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10-full - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 idle-python3.10 - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10-minimal - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10-dev - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 python3.10-nopie - 3.10.4-3ubuntu0.1 No subscription required
